stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on building “part 4” of the overworld—a cave-tunnel that connects the early lighthouse vista to the upper lighthouse plateau—while fixing bugs and debating seamless area loading.

development_findings.summary: End-screen transition speeded up and a render bug removed after viewer complaints.
development_findings.quote: I fixed the end screen transition a little bit and it goes by faster now and the render bug is gone.

development_findings.summary: Working on the cave tunnel (part 4) that completes the loop from the starting area to the lighthouse top and intends it to feel like a ‘cool’ payoff moment.
development_findings.quote: You start overworld 1 here… you go into the cave… and then after you come out you’re gonna be here up top at the lighthouse. I think that's gonna be a really cool experience.

development_findings.summary: Considering a fully seamless overworld but current N64 engine limits (memory, inability to render during loads) mean separate levels with ‘seamless warps’ and a brief freeze-frame load is the likely compromise.
development_findings.quote: Making this perfectly seamless actually doesn't work because of compression… maybe the game just has to pause for a little bit.

development_findings.summary: Soren proposed an animation-compression technique that could save performance; Kaze is evaluating it.
Fast travel system undecided: corked pipes that unlock from one side were the initial plan, but a pause-menu world map warp is now being seriously considered.
development_findings.quote: Man, that's tempting too… I think we need to do that.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 remains the primary level-building tool and Kaze has no intention of replacing it.
development_findings.quote: I would never want to try to replace fast64, they're doing a really good job with it.

development_findings.summary: All 12 main courses are finished in rough form, but many will be visually and mechanically reworked; Biobak is almost done re-doing Course 2 and may become the schedule bottleneck.
development_findings.quote: All 12 main courses are done, but Biobak still will rework a lot of them, so there's still lots of work to do.

development_findings.summary: Exploring physical cartridge release of the game’s OST; releasing the actual game physically is ruled out due to legal risk.
development_findings.quote: I can't release the game physically and I will actually get murdered.

context_findings.summary: Kaze has been ill for about five days, affecting his energy and eating habits but continues to stream and develop.
context_findings.quote: Dude I've been sick for like five days… I'm actually not feeling hungry.

context_findings.summary: Shows design philosophy: the hub world should be designed last so all information is available.
context_findings.quote: The hub is the most important part, you need to make it with all the information available to you.

context_findings.summary: Expresses admiration for ROM-hacker Rionu and consciously borrows ideas (e.g., ‘Vauri operation’).
context_findings.quote: I'm a huge Rionu fan and I'm copying whatever Rionu does.

context_findings.summary: Frustration and humor over persistent heater noise, ultimately traced to Zeina turning on an upstairs heater.

biobak.summary: Handling most level visual reworks and is nearly finished with Course 2.
biobak.quote: It's mostly Biobak doing them, I think he's almost done with course 2 now.

biobak.summary: Questions the use of pipes for fast travel, prompting further design debate.

zeina.summary: Accidentally caused loud heater/furnace noise during the stream by turning on heat upstairs.
zeina.quote: It was Zeina all along… and it stopped immediately.

zeina.summary: Asked if the overworld should be fully seamless, showing engagement with design decisions.

key_stories.title: Seamless Overworld vs. N64 Limits
key_stories.summary: Kaze loves the idea of walking the island without warp screens but realizes the N64 engine can’t stream new areas while rendering. After exploring memory constraints and Makefile limitations, he settles on brief freeze-frame transitions as a pragmatic middle ground.
key_stories.process: Measured tunnel lengths, discussed dynamic loading, and analyzed engine loading behavior.
key_stories.outcome: Decided on separate areas with ‘seamless’ warps and a short frozen frame during loads.
key_stories.key_quote: Maybe the game just has to pause for a little bit.

key_stories.title: Fast-Travel Debate
key_stories.summary: The team needs an efficient back-tracking method. Kaze proposes corked pipes; Biobak dislikes pipes; chat suggestions lead Kaze to imagine a world-map cursor accessible from the pause menu.
key_stories.challenge: Design an intuitive, lore-friendly fast-travel mechanic.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed ropes, vines, cannons, colored pipes, and finally a map-based warp.
key_stories.outcome: No final decision yet; Kaze has added a note to prototype the world-map approach.
key_stories.key_quote: That sounds so cool… I think we need to do that.

key_stories.title: The Heater Mystery
key_stories.summary: A persistent furnace noise disrupts the stream. After multiple interruptions, Kaze discovers Zeina unknowingly activated the upstairs heater, instantly silencing the noise.
key_stories.challenge: Identify and eliminate an irritating background sound during development.
key_stories.process: Complained, paused work, tested fixes; eventually confronted Zeina.
key_stories.outcome: Noise stopped; humorous moment lightened the stream.
key_stories.key_quote: Oh my god, it stopped immediately. Zeina, do you know what you did?
